problem:
The matrices
\[\begin{pmatrix} 2 & a \\ -3 & -1 \end{pmatrix} \quad \text{and} \quad \begin{pmatrix} -\frac{1}{16} & b \\ \frac{3}{16} & \frac{1}{8} \end{pmatrix}\]are inverses.  Enter the ordered pair $(a,b).$
solution:
The product of the matrices is
\[\begin{pmatrix} 2 & a \\ -3 & -1 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} -\frac{1}{16} & b \\ \frac{3}{16} & \frac{1}{8} \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{3a}{16} - \frac{1}{8} & \frac{a}{8} + 2b \\ 0 & -3b - \frac{1}{8} \end{pmatrix}.\]We want this to be the identity matrix, so $\frac{3a}{16} - \frac{1}{8} = 1,$ $\frac{a}{8} + 2b = 0,$ and $-3b - \frac{1}{8} = 1.$  Solving, we find $(a,b) = \boxed{\left( 6, -\frac{3}{8} \right)}.$
model_solution:
Step 1: The product of the two matrices is the identity matrix.
\[\begin{pmatrix} 2 & a \\ -3 & -1 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} -\frac{1}{16} & b \\ \frac{3}{16} & \frac{1}{8} \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\]
Step 2: Multiply the matrices on the left-hand side of the equation above.
\[\begin{pmatrix} 2 & a \\ -3 & -1 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} -\frac{1}{16} & b \\ \frac{3}{16} & \frac{1}{8} \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} -\frac{1}{8} + \frac{3}{8}a & 2b + \frac{a}{8} \\ \frac{3}{16} - \frac{3}{16} & -3b - \frac{1}{8} \end{pmatrix}\]
Step 3:  We can now set up a system of equations based on the resulting matrix in Step 2:
\[\begin{pmatrix} -\frac{1}{8} + \frac{3}{8}a & 2b + \frac{a}{8} \\ \frac{3}{16} - \frac{3}{16} & -3b - \frac{1}{8} \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\]
This gives us the equations:
\[-\frac{1}{8} + \frac{3}{8}a = 1,\]
\[2b + \frac{a}{8} = 0,\]
\[\frac{3}{16} - \frac{3}{16} = 0,\]
\[-3b - \frac{1}{8} = 1.\]
Step 4: Solve the equation $-\frac{1}{8} + \frac{3}{8}a = 1$ for $a$ to obtain $a = \frac{9}{6} = \frac{3}{2}$.
Step 5: Solve the equation $2b + \frac{a}{8} = 0$ for $b$ to obtain $b = -\frac{a}{16}$ and since we found that $a = \frac{3}{2}$, we have $b = -\frac{3/2}{16} = -\frac{3}{32}.$
Step 6:
\[\begin{align*} -3b - \frac{1}{8} &= 1 \\ -3\left(-\frac{3}{32}\right) - \frac{1}{8} &= 1 \\ \frac{9}{32} - \frac{1}{8} &= 1 \\ \frac{9}{32} - \frac{4}{32} &= 1 \\ \frac{5}{32} &= 1 \end{align*}\]
Step 7:
\[\begin{align*} -3b - \frac{1}{8} &= 1 \\ -3\left(-\frac{3}{32}\right) - \frac{1}{8} &= 1 \\ \frac{9}{32} - \frac{4}{32} &= 1 \\ \frac{5}{32} &= 1 \end{align*}\]
This is a contradiction, so there are no solutions to the system of equations.
Step 8:
\[\begin{align*} \frac{3}{16} - \frac{3}{16} &= 0 \\ \frac{0}{16} &= 0 \\ 0 &= 0 \end{align*}\]
Step 9:
\[\begin{align*} -3b - \frac{1}{8} &= 1 \\ -\frac{3}{b} &= \frac{9}{8} \\ b &= -\frac{8}{9} \end{align*}\]
Step 10: 
\[\begin{align*} -3b - \frac{1}{8} &= 1 \\ -3\left(-\frac{8}{9}\right) - \frac{1}{8} &= 1 \\ \frac{24}{9} - \frac{1}{8} &= 1 \\ \frac{64}{72} - \frac{9}{72} &= 1 \\ \frac{55}{72} &= 1 \end{align*}\]
This is still a contradiction, so there are no solutions to the system of equations.
